contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. It is implied that God will give Zechariah what he has asked for. Alternate translation: "God has heard your prayer and will give you what you have asked for" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: your prayer has been heard

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the Holy Spirit will empower him" or "the Holy Spirit will guide him" Make sure it does not sound similar to what an evil spirit might do to a person. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he will be filled with the Holy Spirit

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God sent me to speak to you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I was sent to speak to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God told the angel Gabriel to go" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἀπεστάλη ὁ ἄγγελος Γαβριὴλ ἀπὸ τοῦ Θεοῦ
contextId.glQuote: the angel Gabriel was sent from God

contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) "people will call him" or 2) "God will call him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be called

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "So they will call the holy one who will be born the Son of God" or "So the baby that will be born will be holy, and people will call him the Son of God" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: διὸ ... τὸ γεννώμενον Ἅγιον κληθήσεται, Υἱὸς Θεοῦ
contextId.glQuote: So the holy one to be born will be called the Son of God

contextId.occurrenceNote: The passive verb can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will bless her because she believed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Blessed is she who believed

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "from" is used here instead of "by" because it was the angel Gabriel whom Mary actually heard speak (see [Luke 1:26] (../01/26.md)), but the message ("the things") came ultimately from the Lord. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the message that she heard from the Lord" or "the Lord's message that the angel told her" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: the things that were told her from the Lord

contextId.occurrenceNote: These phrases can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God opened his mouth and freed his tongue" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: his mouth was opened and his tongue was freed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The Holy Spirit filled his father Zechariah, and Zachariah prophesied" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Ζαχαρίας ὁ πατὴρ αὐτοῦ, ἐπλήσθη Πνεύματος Ἁγίου καὶ ἐπροφήτευσεν
contextId.glQuote: His father Zechariah was filled with the Holy Spirit and prophesied

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that we would serve him without fear after he rescued us from the hand of our enemies" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that we, having been delivered out of the hand of our enemies, would serve him without fear

contextId.occurrenceNote: People will realize that he is a prophet. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people will know that you are a prophet" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you, child, will be called a prophet

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that they register all the people living in the world" or "that they count all the people in the world and write down their names" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that a census be taken of all the people living in the world

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will give you this sign" or "You will see this sign from God" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: This is the sign that will be given to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "what the angels had told the shepherds" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: what had been said to them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "what the shepherds told them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τῶν λαληθέντων ὑπὸ τῶν ποιμένων πρὸς αὐτούς
contextId.glQuote: what was spoken to them by the shepherds

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the name the angel had called him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the name he had been given by the angel

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the number of days that God required" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the required number of days

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "As Moses wrote" or "They did this because Moses wrote" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: As it is written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The Holy Spirit had shown him" or "The Holy Spirit had told him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἦν αὐτῷ κεχρηματισμένον ὑπὸ τοῦ Πνεύματος τοῦ Ἁγίου
contextId.glQuote: It had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "As the Holy Spirit directed him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Led by the Spirit

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the things that Simeon said about him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: what was said about him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that the law of the Lord required them to do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they were required to do according to the law of the Lord

contextId.occurrenceNote: These words introduce a quotation from the prophet Isaiah. They can be stated in active form, and the missing words can be supplied. Alternate translation: "This happened as Isaiah the prophet had written in the book that contains his words" or "John fulfilled the message that the prophet Isaiah had written in his book" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: ὡς γέγραπται ἐν βίβλῳ λόγων Ἠσαΐου τοῦ προφήτου
contextId.glQuote: As it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They will fill in every low place in the road" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Every valley will be filled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they will level every mountain and hill" or "they will remove every high place in the road" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: every mountain and hill will be made low

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "for John to baptize them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to be baptized by him

contextId.occurrenceNote: The ax that is in position so it can cut the roots of a tree is a metaphor for the punishment that is about to begin. It can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God is like the man who has placed his ax against the root of the trees" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.quote: ἡ ἀξίνη πρὸς τὴν ῥίζαν τῶν δένδρων κεῖται
contextId.glQuote: the ax is set against the root of the trees

contextId.occurrenceNote: "fire" here is a metaphor for punishment. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he chops down every tree ... and throws it into the fire" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: every tree ... is chopped down and thrown into the fire

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "for John to baptize them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to be baptized

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is passive to show that the tax collector's authority comes from Rome. Alternate translation: "than what the Romans have authorized you to take" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: than you have been ordered to collect

contextId.occurrenceNote: "while John baptized all the people." The phrase "all the people" refers to the people present with John. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: when all the people were baptized

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "John baptized Jesus also" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Jesus also was baptized

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the Spirit led him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: was led by the Spirit

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form, and you can make explicit what it was the devil tempted him to do. Alternate translation: "the devil tried to persuade him disobey God" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: he was tempted by the devil

contextId.occurrenceNote: The quotation is from Moses' writings in the Old Testament. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Moses has written in the scriptures" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It is written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Moses has written in the scriptures" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It is written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the writer has written" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it is written

contextId.occurrenceNote: Jesus quotes from the writings of Moses in Deuteronomy. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Moses has said" or "Moses has said in the scriptures" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It is said

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Someone gave him the scroll of the prophet Isaiah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἐπεδόθη αὐτῷ βιβλίον τοῦ προφήτου Ἠσαΐου
contextId.glQuote: The scroll of the prophet Isaiah was handed to him

contextId.occurrenceNote: Jesus was saying that he was fulfilling that prophecy by his actions and speech at that very time. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I am fulfilling what this scripture said right now as you are listening to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: πεπλήρωται ἡ Γραφὴ αὕτη ἐν τοῖς ὠσὶν ὑμῶν
contextId.glQuote: this scripture has been fulfilled in your hearing

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "this is the reason God sent me here" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: this is the reason I was sent here

contextId.occurrenceNote: "the report about him went out even farther." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people kept telling the news about him in other places" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: διήρχετο ... μᾶλλον ὁ λόγος περὶ αὐτοῦ
contextId.glQuote: the report about him spread even farther

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you are forgiven" or "I forgive your sins" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: your sins are forgiven you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the wine would spill out of the bags" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the wine would be spilled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "for Jesus to heal them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to be healed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Jesus also healed people who were troubled with unclean spirits" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: People who were troubled with unclean spirits were also healed

contextId.occurrenceNote: Jesus does not say who would not judge. Possible meanings are 1) "God will not judge you" or 2) "no one will judge you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will not be judged

contextId.occurrenceNote: Jesus does not say who would not condemn. Possible meanings are 1) "God will not condemn you" or 2) "no one will condemn you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will not be condemned

contextId.occurrenceNote: Jesus does not say who would forgive. Possible meanings are 1) "God will forgive you" or 2) "people will forgive you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will be forgiven

contextId.occurrenceNote: Jesus does not say exactly who will give. Possible meanings are 1) "someone will give it to you" or 2) "God will give it to you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it will be given to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: Jesus does not say exactly who will measure. Possible meanings are 1) "they will measure things back to you" or 2) "God will measure things back to you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it will be measured back to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: People recognize the kind of tree by the fruit it bears. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people know the type of a tree" or "people recognize a tree" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: each tree is known

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "because the man had built it well" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: because it had been well built

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people were carrying out of the city a man who had died" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a man who had died was being carried out

contextId.occurrenceNote: "fear filled all of them." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they all became very afraid" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: fear overcame all of them

contextId.occurrenceNote: They were referring to Jesus, not to some unidentified prophet. "Raised" here is an idiom for "caused to become." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God has caused one of us to become a great prophet" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]]) (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: A great prophet has been raised among us

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will bless the person who does not stop believing in me because of my actions" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The person who does not stop believing in me because of my actions is blessed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "because they had let John baptize them" or "because John had baptized them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: because they had been baptized with the baptism of John

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they did not let John baptize them" or "they rejected John's baptism" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they had not been baptized by John

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God has forgiven her many sins" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἀφέωνται αἱ ἁμαρτίαι αὐτῆς αἱ πολλαί
contextId.glQuote: her sins, which were many, have been forgiven

contextId.occurrenceNote: "You are forgiven." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I forgive your sins" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Your sins are forgiven

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom Jesus had set free from evil spirits and healed of diseases" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: αἳ ἦσαν τεθεραπευμέναι ἀπὸ πνευμάτων πονηρῶν καὶ ἀσθενειῶν
contextId.glQuote: who had been healed of evil spirits and diseases

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Mary, whom people called Magdalene ... Jesus had driven out seven demons" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Mary who was called Magdalene ... seven demons had been driven out

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people walked on it" or "people walked on them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it was trampled underfoot

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God has given to you the knowledge of ... God" or "God has made you able to understand ... God" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The knowledge of ... God has been given to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is the devil's purpose. Alternate translation: "because the devil thinks, 'They must not believe and they must not be saved'" or "so it will not be that they believe and God saves them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so they may not believe and be saved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the cares and riches and pleasures of this life choke them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they are choked ... pleasures of this life

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People told him" or "Someone told him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He was told

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "though the people had bound him with chains and shackles and guarded him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: though he was bound ... and kept under guard

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the demon would make him go" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he would be driven by the demon

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Jesus had healed the man whom demons had possessed" or "Jesus had healed the man whom demons had controlled" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the man who had been possessed by demons had been healed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they became very afraid" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they were overwhelmed with great fear

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "but no one could heal her" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: and could not be healed by anyone

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "some people said" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it was said by some

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the elders, chief priests, and scribes will reject him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἀποδοκιμασθῆναι ἀπὸ τῶν πρεσβυτέρων, καὶ ἀρχιερέων, καὶ γραμματέων
contextId.glQuote: be rejected by the elders and chief priests and scribes

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they will kill him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he will be killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: "he will ... be made alive again." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will ... make him alive again" or "he will ... live again" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he will ... be raised

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the Son of Man will also be ashamed of him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τοῦτον ὁ Υἱὸς τοῦ Ἀνθρώπου ἐπαισχυνθήσεται
contextId.glQuote: of him will the Son of Man be ashamed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated with an active form. Alternate translation: "the one I have chosen" or "I have chosen him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the one who is chosen

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated with an active clause. Here "hands" refers to power or control. Alternate translation: "they will betray the Son of Man and put him in the control of men" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: The Son of Man will be betrayed into the hands of men

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God hid the meaning from them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It was hidden from them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "eat whatever food they give you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: eat what is set before you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you will go down to Hades" or "God will send you to Hades" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will be brought down to Hades

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God has written your names in heaven" or "your names are on the list of people who are citizens of heaven" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: your names are engraved in heaven

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "My Father has handed everything over to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: πάντα μοι παρεδόθη ὑπὸ τοῦ Πατρός μου
contextId.glQuote: All things have been entrusted to me from my Father

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be asked in active form. Alternate translation: "What did Moses write in the law?" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: What is written in the law?

contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) "I will not take this opportunity away from her" or 2) "she will not lose what she has gained as she was listening to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: which will not be taken away from her

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will give it to you" or "you will receive it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it will be given to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will open the door for you" or "God will welcome you inside" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it will be opened to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This metaphor speaks about the person as if he were a house that is swept clean and things put in their places. It is implied that the house is still empty. This can be stated in active form with that information made explicit. Alternate translation: "finds that the person is like a house that someone has swept clean and organized by putting everything where it belongs, but has left empty" or "finds that the person is like a house that is clean and organized, but empty" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: finds that house swept out and put in order

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will not give it a sign" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: no sign will be given to it

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the light will fill your whole body" or "you will be able to see everything clearly" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the whole body is filled with light

contextId.occurrenceNote: This could be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that the people killed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who was killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: "everything that is hidden will be shown." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people will find out about everything that people do secretly" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: there is nothing concealed that will not be revealed

contextId.occurrenceNote: "will be shouted loudly." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people will proclaim" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be proclaimed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This could be stated in active form and in positive form. Alternate translation: "God never forgets any of them" or "God indeed remembers every sparrow" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-litotes]])
contextId.quote: ἓν ἐξ αὐτῶν οὐκ ἔστιν ἐπιλελησμένον ἐνώπιον τοῦ Θεοῦ
contextId.glQuote: not one of them is forgotten in the sight of God

contextId.occurrenceNote: This could be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God knows even how many hairs are on your head" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: καὶ αἱ τρίχες τῆς κεφαλῆς ὑμῶν πᾶσαι ἠρίθμηνται
contextId.glQuote: even the hairs of your head are all numbered

contextId.occurrenceNote: "will be disowned." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the Son of Man will deny him" or "I will deny that he is my disciple" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be denied

contextId.occurrenceNote: "he will be forgiven." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will forgive him for that" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it will be forgiven him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed with an active verb. Alternate translation: "but he ... God will not forgive him" or "but he ... God will consider him guilty forever" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-litotes]])
contextId.glQuote: but to him ... it will not be forgiven

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone throws it into a fire" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: is thrown into the oven

contextId.occurrenceNote: "these things also will be given to you." "These things" refers to food and clothing. This could be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will also give you these things" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: these things will be added to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "keep your lamps burning" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: let your lamps be kept burning

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he would not have let the thief break into his house" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: οὐκ ἂν ἀφῆκεν διορυχθῆναι τὸν οἶκον αὐτοῦ
contextId.glQuote: he would not have let his house be broken into

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "But as for the servant who knows his lord's will does not prepare or do according to it, the master will beat him with many blows" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: That servant, having known his lord's will, and not having prepared or done according to his will, will be beaten with many blows

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They will require more of anyone who has received much" or "The master will require more of everyone he has given much to" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: But everyone who has been given much, from them much will be required

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the master will ask even more of the one ... much" or "the master will require even more of the one ... much" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the one ... much, even more will be asked

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the one to whom the master has given much property to take care of" or "the one to whom the master has given much responsibility" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the one who has been entrusted with much

contextId.occurrenceNote: "Woman, you are healed from your disease." This can be expressed with an active verb: Alternate translation: "Woman, I have set you free from your weakness" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Woman, you are freed from your weakness

contextId.occurrenceNote: This could be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "she stood up straight" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: she was straightened up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This could be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "let someone heal you during those six days" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: be healed then

contextId.occurrenceNote: This could be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "will God save only a few people?" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: are only a few people to be saved?

contextId.occurrenceNote: "but you yourselves will have been thrown outside." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "but God will have forced you outside" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: but you are thrown out

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "those God has sent to you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those sent to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: It may be helpful to identify these people, and to state this in active form. Alternate translation: "those whom the leader of the Pharisees had invited to the meal" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those who were invited

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "When someone invites you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: When you are invited by someone

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "because the host may have invited a person who is more important than you are" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: because someone may have been invited who is more honored than you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "when someone invites you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: when you are invited

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Then the one who invited you will honor you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Then you will be honored

contextId.occurrenceNote: "will be shown to be unimportant" or "will be given an unimportant position." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will humble" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be humbled

contextId.occurrenceNote: "will be shown to be important" or "will be given an important position." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will exalt" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be exalted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "in this way they will repay you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will be repaid

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will bless you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will be blessed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will repay you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will be repaid

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "those he had invited" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those who were invited

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I have done what you commanded" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: what you commanded has been done

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom I invited" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who were invited

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Someone just throws it away" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It is thrown away

contextId.occurrenceNote: "I am not worthy to be called your son." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I am not worthy for you to call me son" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: οὐκέτι εἰμὶ ἄξιος κληθῆναι υἱός σου
contextId.glQuote: I am no longer worthy to be called your son

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. See how you translated a similar phrase in [Luke 15:18](../15/18.md). Alternate translation: "I am not worthy for you to call me your son" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: οὐκέτι εἰμὶ ἄξιος κληθῆναι υἱός σου
contextId.glQuote: I am no longer worthy to be called your son

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people reported to the rich man" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it was reported to him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "when I lose my management job" or "when my master takes away my management job" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: when I am removed from my management job

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Those things that men think are very important are things that God hates" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τὸ ἐν ἀνθρώποις ὑψηλὸν, βδέλυγμα ἐνώπιον τοῦ Θεοῦ
contextId.glQuote: That which is exalted among men is detestable in the sight of God

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I am teaching people about the good news of the kingdom of God" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the gospel of the kingdom of God is preached

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People had laid a certain beggar named Lazarus at his gate" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-names]])
contextId.quote: πτωχὸς ... τις ὀνόματι Λάζαρος, ἐβέβλητο πρὸς τὸν πυλῶνα αὐτοῦ
contextId.glQuote: A certain beggar named Lazarus was laid at his gate

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the angels carried him away" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: was carried away by the angels

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people buried him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: was buried

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God has placed a huge ravine between you and us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a great chasm has been put in place

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "if they were to put a millstone around his neck and throw him" or "if someone were to put a heavy stone around his neck and push him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: λίθος μυλικὸς περίκειται περὶ τὸν τράχηλον αὐτοῦ, καὶ ἔρριπται
contextId.glQuote: a millstone were put around his neck and he were thrown

contextId.occurrenceNote: These can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Uproot yourself and plant yourself in the sea" or "Take your roots out of the ground, and put your roots down into the ocean" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἐκριζώθητι‘ καὶ φυτεύθητι ἐν τῇ θαλάσσῃ
contextId.glQuote: Be uprooted, and be planted in the sea

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the things you commanded him to do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the things that were commanded

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that God has commanded you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that you are commanded

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "ten men who were lepers met him" or "ten men who had leprosy met him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: there he was met by ten men who were lepers

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the people of this generation must reject him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: be rejected by this generation

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "parents were allowing their daughters to marry men" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they were given in marriage

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "when the Son of Man appears" or "when the Son of man comes" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: in the day that the Son of Man is revealed

contextId.occurrenceNote: "One person will be taken and the other person will be left behind." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will take one person and leave the other" or "Angels will take one and leave behind the other" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ὁ εἷς παραλημφθήσεται, καὶ ὁ ἕτερος ἀφεθήσεται
contextId.glQuote: One will be taken, and the other will be left

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will humble" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be humbled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will greatly honor" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be exalted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that the prophets have written" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that have been written by the prophets

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "will happen" or "will occur" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be accomplished

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "For the Jewish leaders will give him over to the Gentiles" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For he will be given over to the Gentiles

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they will mock him, treat him shamefully, and spit on him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be mocked, and shamefully treated, and spit upon

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form, but it is not clear whether it is God or Jesus who hid the word from them. Alternate translation: "Jesus hid his message from them" or "God prevented them from understanding the meaning of what Jesus was telling them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἦν τὸ ῥῆμα τοῦτο κεκρυμμένον ἀπ’ αὐτῶν
contextId.glQuote: this word was hidden from them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the things that Jesus said" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the things that were said

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the people to bring the blind man to him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that the man be brought to him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "to come to him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to be called to him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will take away from him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be taken away

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that no one has ever ridden" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that has never been ridden

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The two disciples that Jesus sent" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Those who were sent

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a quotation from Isaiah. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The scriptures say" or "A prophet wrote these words in the scriptures" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It is written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a result of falling onto the stone. It can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "will break up into pieces" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be broken to pieces

contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) "you tell the truth even if important people do not like it" or 2) "you do not favor one person over another" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: are not influenced by anyone's position

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the people in that age whom God will consider to be worthy" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: οἱ δὲ καταξιωθέντες τοῦ αἰῶνος ἐκείνου
contextId.glQuote: those who are regarded as worthy in that age

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "even" is here because the Sadducees might not have been surprised that some scriptures say that the dead are raised, but they did not expect Moses to have written something like that. Alternate translation: "But even Moses showed that dead people rise from the dead" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ὅτι δὲ ἐγείρονται οἱ νεκροὶ, καὶ Μωϋσῆς ἐμήνυσεν
contextId.glQuote: But that the dead are raised, even Moses showed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God causes the dead to live again" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the dead are raised

contextId.occurrenceNote: "They will receive a more severe judgment." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will certainly punish them very severely" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Men like this will receive greater condemnation

contextId.occurrenceNote: A new sentence can be started here. Alternate translation: "left on another. They will all be torn down" or "left on another. Enemies will tear down every stone" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἀφεθήσεται ... ἐπὶ λίθῳ, ὃς οὐ καταλυθήσεται
contextId.glQuote: left on another which will not be torn down

contextId.occurrenceNote: A new sentence can be started here. Alternate translation: "left on another. They will all be torn down" or "left on another. Enemies will tear down every stone" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἀφεθήσεται ... ἐπὶ λίθῳ, ὃς οὐ καταλυθήσεται
contextId.glQuote: left on another which will not be torn down

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "even your parents, brothers, relatives, and friends will give you over to the authorities" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will be delivered up also by parents, brothers, relatives, and friends

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "armies surrounding Jerusalem" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Jerusalem surrounded by armies

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "all the things that the prophets wrote in the scriptures long ago" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all the things that are written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "will happen" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be fulfilled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "their enemies will capture them and take them to other countries" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they will be led captive into all the nations

contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) the Gentiles will conquer Jerusalem and occupy it or 2) the Gentiles will destroy the city of Jerusalem or 3) the Gentiles will destroy the people of Jerusalem. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Jerusalem will be trampled by the Gentiles

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the period of the Gentiles has come to an end" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) that God will shake the sun moon and stars so they do not move in their normal way or 2) God will trouble the powerful spirits in the heavens. The first is recommended. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the powers of the heavens will be shaken

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) until the purpose of the Passover Festival is accomplished. Alternate translation: "until God fulfills it" or "until God completes the purpose of the Passover Festival" or 2) "until we celebrate the final Passover Festival" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: until it is fulfilled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "my body, which I will give for you" or "my body, which I will sacrifice for you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τὸ σῶμά μου, τὸ ὑπὲρ ὑμῶν διδόμενον
contextId.glQuote: my body which is given for you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "as God has determined" or "as God has planned" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: as it has been determined

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "But woe to the man who betrays the Son of Man" or "But how terrible it will be for that man who betrays the Son of Man" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: πλὴν οὐαὶ τῷ ἀνθρώπῳ ἐκείνῳ δι’ οὗ παραδίδοται
contextId.glQuote: But woe to that man through whom he is betrayed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "was the most important" or "the people would think was most important" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: was considered to be greatest

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "what a prophet wrote about me in the scriptures" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: what is written about me

contextId.occurrenceNote: The apostles would have understood that God would cause everything written in the scriptures to happen. Alternate translation: "God will fulfill" or "God will cause to happen" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: must be fulfilled

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here Jesus is quoting the scriptures. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People counted him as a member of the group of lawless men" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He was counted with the lawless ones

contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) "For what the prophet predicted about me is about to happen" or 2) "For my life is coming to an end" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For what is predicted about me is being fulfilled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "However, do what is according to your will rather than what is according to my will" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: πλὴν μὴ τὸ θέλημά μου, ἀλλὰ ... σὸν γινέσθω
contextId.glQuote: Nevertheless not my will, but yours be done

contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) "The elders had Jesus brought into the council" or 2) "The guards led Jesus into the council of the elders." Some languages may avoid saying who led him by using the pronoun "they" or by using a passive verb: "Jesus was led into the council" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They led him into the council

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "to see him perform some kind of miracle" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τι σημεῖον ἰδεῖν ὑπ’ αὐτοῦ γινόμενον
contextId.glQuote: to see some miracle done by him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he has not done anything to deserve a death sentence" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: οὐδὲν ἄξιον θανάτου ἐστὶν πεπραγμένον αὐτῷ
contextId.glQuote: nothing worthy of death has been done by him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom the Romans had put in prison" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who had been put into prison

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "for Pilate to have his soldiers crucify Jesus" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: for him to be crucified

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The soldiers led away with Jesus two criminals to execute them also" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Other men, two criminals, were led away with him to be put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: "the curtain of the temple was torn into two pieces." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God tore the temple curtain into two pieces from the top to the bottom" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the curtain of the temple was split in two

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "all the things that had happened" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: what was done

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "what had happened" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the things that were done

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "which someone had cut in a rock cliff" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that was cut in stone

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "walked along behind Joseph and the men who were with him; the women saw the tomb and how the men laid Jesus' body inside the tomb" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: followed and saw the tomb and how his body was laid

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that someone had rolled the stone" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the stone rolled away

contextId.occurrenceNote: "but he has been made alive again." "Raised" here is an idiom for "caused to live again." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "because God has made him alive again" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: but has been raised

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "must be" means this is something that would certainly happen because God had already decided that it would happen. This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "it was necessary that they hand the Son of Man over to sinful men who would crucify him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τὸν‘ Υἱὸν τοῦ Ἀνθρώπου ... δεῖ παραδοθῆναι εἰς χεῖρας ἀνθρώπων ἁμαρτωλῶν, καὶ σταυρωθῆναι
contextId.glQuote: the Son of Man must be delivered up into the hands of sinful men and be crucified

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "in order for the governor to put Jesus to death by crucifying him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: εἰς κρίμα θανάτου, καὶ ἐσταύρωσαν αὐτόν
contextId.glQuote: to be condemned to death and crucified him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "how they recognized Jesus" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: how Jesus was shown to them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God would fulfill all that was written ... Psalms" or "God would cause all that was written ... Psalms to happen" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all that was written ... Psalms must be fulfilled

contextId.occurrenceNote: The words "law of Moses," "the Prophets," and "the Psalms" are proper names for parts of the Hebrew Bible. This can be stated in active form and using common nouns. Alternate translation: "all that Moses wrote in the law, all that the prophets wrote, and all that the writers of the Psalms wrote about me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: πάντα τὰ γεγραμμένα ἐν τῷ νόμῳ Μωϋσέως, καὶ τοῖς προφήταις, καὶ ψαλμοῖς
contextId.glQuote: all that was written in the law of Moses and the Prophets and the Psalms

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "This is what people long ago wrote" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Thus it is written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Followers of the Christ should preach to people in all the nations that they need to repent and that they need God to forgive their sins through Jesus" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Repentance and forgiveness of sins should be preached in his name to all the nations

contextId.occurrenceNote: Since Luke does not specify who carried Jesus up, we do not know if it was God himself or one or more angels. If your language would have to specify who did the carrying, it would be better to use "went" instead, as the UST does. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: was carried
